description: From French or Old French ignominieux, from Latin ignōminiōsus (“disgraceful”), from ignōminia (“loss of a good name, ignominy”), from ig- (“not”) + nomen (“name”) (prefix assimilated form of in-). Surface analysis ignominy +‎ -ious.

adjectives.description: ignominious (comparative more ignominious, superlative most ignominious)

entries.meaning: Marked by great dishonor, shame, disgrace or humiliation; shameful, disgraceful
examples: The golden eagle, which glittered in the front of the legion, was the object of their fondest devotion; nor was it esteemed less impious than it was ignominious, to abandon that sacred ensign in the hour of danger.
